data.title: Add damaged actor decorations
data.body:
D2k (and possibly later games) had vehicles smoking when badly damaged, and buildings having flames here and there.
While purely decorational, it adds a nice feel to the game.

data.title: Fixed D2k armament offsets and some cleanup
game crash on mouse over latency with my own 'server'
data.body:
hey since the new release, whenever i use automatic port forwardning (upnp) to make a server everything works, but when i mouse over the latency red/orange/green light, my game will crash.
seems similar like a problem i had before in the older release and i think got it fixed then when i redownloaded red alert

data.title: Movement glitch
data.body:
There is a movement glitch in the latest release. It appears that sometimes, when a unit stops, its visual position is not properly updated and does not match its actual position. When the unit begins moving again, its sprite kinda "morphs" or slides into the correct position. I haven't found a way to reproduce this reliably, but I've seen it a couple of times now.

Edit: [Here's a video illustrating the bug](https://seacloud.cc/d/5d1adbebce/files/?p=/ora_bug9404.mp4). Look at the bottom-left medium tank attacking the E1 on the island.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26864585-movement-glitch?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: AI seems to have two BaseBuilders per construction yard
data.body:
At least in TD. It has a strong tendency to build two radars and two adv. comm. centers even with just 1 construction yard.

So either they have one more basebuilder than they should, or base builders don't stick to their queue type (base or support).

data.title: Fixed massive AI base builder performance issue
data.body:
HackyAI causes occasional BaseBuilder-related lag spikes of anywhere between 200 and 1200(!) milliseconds.

After throwing around with PerfTimers, I narrowed it down to the refinery placement.
In worst-case scenarios, the AI would iterate through all cells with resources inside MaxBaseRadius and perform a full findPos check for each of them.

Now it simply takes the first randomly chosen cell with resources inside MaxBaseRadius and places the refinery in that direction, if possible, and otherwise falls back to a normal placement check.

Closes #4717.

data.title: More options for scrolling with the mouse button and scrolling speeds.
data.body:
I'm at a loss to explain but scrolling with the middle mouse button doesn't feel right to me. It would be nice to have an customizable option on this, or to simply be able to choose between several options including the right mouse button.

Seeing that there's been quite a few requests in the past on scroll speed options, I'd like to include in this issue as well. Now also with a small bounty;)

data.title: Renamed Bib to WithTileFootprintOverlay

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body: Split from #9390.

data.title: Add basic arguments validation
data.body:
This PR is the first step of validation of argument(s) passed through OpenRA.Utility. Target issue #8442
- Add a method [IUtilityCommand](https://github.com/Herve-M/OpenRA/blob/feat-utility-polish/OpenRA.Game/IUtilityCommand.cs#L20)
- Test Argument before calling command [OpenRA.Utility/Program.cs](https://github.com/Herve-M/OpenRA/blob/feat-utility-polish/OpenRA.Utility/Program.cs#L59-L72)
- Impl. basic validation (on args.Length) on all [Utility.Commands](https://github.com/Herve-M/OpenRA/commit/ff82276c2103ab2c06e5926f37170346a7ee8795?diff=unified)

If a command is called without validating, the description is showed.

```
λ OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --shp
Invalid arguments for '--shp'
  --shp PNGFILE [PNGFILE ...]
  Combine a list of PNG images into a SHP
```

If a inexisting command is used, a System.ArgumentException is thrown without crashing / showing it. 

```
λ OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --sh
No such command '--sh'
```

**Special attention for validation** : see if UnityCommands:ValidateArguments are just.

data.title: Added a stub Red Alert 2 mod
data.body:
This only adds auto-generated tileset definitions and a very basic mod which allows asset exploration and new map creation. The game rules contributed by the RA2 team in external repositories and branches can be rebased and added one after another in separate pull requests to ease the review and to keep original authorship.

Changes from https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA include:
- Added gems and avoid Tiberium/BlueTiberium naming towards players.
- Shroud and fog is working.
- Blank shellmap doesn't use repeated tiles and non-isometric borders.
- The C&C: Red Alert 2 logo and wordmark is avoided.
- Uses the UI skin made by @x-a-n-a-x.
- Icon based on the retrace from @Tomsons26 instead of RA2 cover art.
- No unused fake test trait in the RA2 mod DLL.
- Tilesets use the correct RA2 categories and unit palettes.

data.title: Fixed the OpenAL device not being properly closed
data.body:
I always get reminded in the command line when closing the game.

> AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed

data.title: Unstatic the Sound class.
data.body: Followup to #9274.  This unstatics the `Sound` class, and moves it to a static field in Game to make it consistent with how we access the renderer.

data.title: Renamed WithMuzzleFlash to WithMuzzleOverlay
Fix replay freeze
data.body:
This PR normally fix the freezing problem when a player disconnect from game.
- Get the list of client 
  - Get all clients + last frame [ReplayConnection.cs#L59-L65](https://github.com/Herve-M/OpenRA/blob/fix-replay/OpenRA.Game/Network/ReplayConnection.cs#L59-L65)
- Correct the datas
  - Parsing (2nd pass) [ReplayConnection.cs#L97-L112](https://github.com/Herve-M/OpenRA/blob/fix-replay/OpenRA.Game/Network/ReplayConnection.cs#L97-L112)
  - Using 4 first byte from packet to store frame n° [ReplayConnection.cs#L108](https://github.com/Herve-M/OpenRA/blob/fix-replay/OpenRA.Game/Network/ReplayConnection.cs#L108)

More info's [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6241#issuecomment-140373166)
Was tested on release-20150424 (depend of given replay files)

data.title: visual glitches ubuntu
data.body:

I use ubuntu 15.04 and Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu4)

data.title: Add game speed dropdown to the mission browser.
data.body:
![screen shot 2015-09-19 at 20 37 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/9977915/0e846f4c-5f11-11e5-9758-c2b692b9e260.png)

This exposes a game speed dropdown in the mission browser, and makes the difficulty dropdown visible for all mods.  Also renames Default → Normal speed to be consistent with the difficulties.

data.title: Finish wrapping ActorInfo.Traits
Harvesters transported by Carryalls are ordered to find resources by the AI
data.body: Technically it counts as waiting and idle so it constantly forces path searches for new resources which is expensive and needless. Revealed by the debug message I added in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9256.

data.title: Added a lint check for player palette references.
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9101.

data.title: Attack Move order doesn't work for Tanya in Allies01 (and probably other missions)
data.body:
You can issue the attack-move order for a group of actors, but tanya will stay at her original location.  She should at least move to the target location, even though these missions have explicitly disabled auto-targeting.

data.title: Add pure cells getter to IOccupySpace.
data.body:
There are a bunch of places where we call `OccupiedCells()` and then throw away the subcell components.  It would be more efficient (in terms of speed, code, or both) if we introduced a version of this method that returned a collection of cells directly.

data.title: Misleading YamlException
data.body:
`Exception of type OpenRA.YamlException: Actor type ^building: Junk value ^SpriteActor on trait node Inhertis`

We should complain that `Inhertis` isn't an existing trait.
